trans-unit.source: The Payout summary shows you details about the money you’ve earned with your apps and in-app products.
trans-unit.target: The Payout summary shows you details about the money you’ve earned with your apps and in-app products.

trans-unit.source: It also lets you know when you’ll receive payments and how much you'll be paid.
trans-unit.target: It also lets you know when you’ll receive payments and how much you'll be paid.

trans-unit.source: Payout summary
trans-unit.target: Payout summary

trans-unit.source: Payout summary
trans-unit.target: Payout summary

trans-unit.source: The **Payout summary** shows you details about the money you’ve earned with your apps and in-app products.
trans-unit.target: The **Payout summary** shows you details about the money you’ve earned with your apps and in-app products.

trans-unit.source: It also lets you know when you’ll receive payments and how much you'll be paid.
trans-unit.target: It also lets you know when you’ll receive payments and how much you'll be paid.

trans-unit.source: If you use Microsoft Advertising to earn money, and your [pubCenter and Dev Center accounts are linked](pubcenter-dev-center-integration.md), you'll also see payment info for advertising proceeds in the **Payout summary**.
trans-unit.target: If you use Microsoft Advertising to earn money, and your [pubCenter and Dev Center accounts are linked](pubcenter-dev-center-integration.md), you'll also see payment info for advertising proceeds in the **Payout summary**.

trans-unit.source: For more details regarding Advertising Payment policies, see the [pubCenter Payment policies](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=624469).
trans-unit.target: For more details regarding Advertising Payment policies, see the [pubCenter Payment policies](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=624469).

trans-unit.source: If you sell products in the Azure Marketplace, you’ll also see info on successful payouts from November 1, 2015 and forward in the **Payout summary**.
trans-unit.target: If you sell products in the Azure Marketplace, you’ll also see info on successful payouts from November 1, 2015 and forward in the **Payout summary**.

trans-unit.source: For more details regarding Azure Marketplace payment, see the [Microsoft Azure Marketplace Participation Policies](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=722436) and the [Microsoft Azure Marketplace Publisher Agreement](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=699560 ).
trans-unit.target: For more details regarding Azure Marketplace payment, see the [Microsoft Azure Marketplace Participation Policies](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=722436) and the [Microsoft Azure Marketplace Publisher Agreement](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=699560 ).

trans-unit.source: More info about viewing earlier Azure Marketplace payout info can be found [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=722439).
trans-unit.target: More info about viewing earlier Azure Marketplace payout info can be found [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=722439).

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: To be eligible for payout, your app proceeds must reach the applicable payment threshold.
trans-unit.target: To be eligible for payout, your app proceeds must reach the applicable payment threshold.

trans-unit.source: If the proceeds are less than the payment threshold, they will remain in the Reserved category until the threshold has been met.
trans-unit.target: If the proceeds are less than the payment threshold, they will remain in the Reserved category until the threshold has been met.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see the [App Developer Agreement](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh694058).
trans-unit.target: For more details, see the [App Developer Agreement](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh694058).

trans-unit.source: Current proceeds and payments
trans-unit.target: Current proceeds and payments

trans-unit.source: Near the top of the page, you’ll find your **Current proceeds and payments**, which contains three sections: **Reserved**, **Upcoming payment**, and **Most recent payment**.
trans-unit.target: Near the top of the page, you’ll find your **Current proceeds and payments**, which contains three sections: **Reserved**, **Upcoming payment**, and **Most recent payment**.

trans-unit.source: **Reserved** shows the amount of money your account has accumulated but which has not yet been scheduled for payment, including advertising proceeds.
trans-unit.target: **Reserved** shows the amount of money your account has accumulated but which has not yet been scheduled for payment, including advertising proceeds.

trans-unit.source: (Azure Marketplace proceeds do not appear in the Reserved section; if you only participate in the Azure Marketplace, you will see $0.00 here.) Proceeds from your most recent advertising and app sales remain on hold for about 30 days before they become eligible for payout.
trans-unit.target: (Azure Marketplace proceeds do not appear in the Reserved section; if you only participate in the Azure Marketplace, you will see $0.00 here.) Proceeds from your most recent advertising and app sales remain on hold for about 30 days before they become eligible for payout.

trans-unit.source: After that, the proceeds will be scheduled for payment the following month (assuming the payment threshold has been met).
trans-unit.target: After that, the proceeds will be scheduled for payment the following month (assuming the payment threshold has been met).

trans-unit.source: When a payment is attempted, your reserved balance will decrease by the payment amount and you will see the amount reflected in **Upcoming payment**.
trans-unit.target: When a payment is attempted, your reserved balance will decrease by the payment amount and you will see the amount reflected in **Upcoming payment**.

trans-unit.source: Note that the amount shown in **Reserved** is an estimate, because exchange rates for sales in other currencies may fluctuate prior to payment creation.
trans-unit.target: Note that the amount shown in **Reserved** is an estimate, because exchange rates for sales in other currencies may fluctuate prior to payment creation.

trans-unit.source: You may notice your reserved balance change slightly at the beginning of every month.
trans-unit.target: You may notice your reserved balance change slightly at the beginning of every month.

trans-unit.source: Your reserved balance is updated monthly to reflect monthly exchange rates, so that it represents a more accurate estimate.
trans-unit.target: Your reserved balance is updated monthly to reflect monthly exchange rates, so that it represents a more accurate estimate.

trans-unit.source: You can click **View details** to see additional information, or click the link to **Download your reserved transactions** to view a .csv file of all your **Reserved** transactions.
trans-unit.target: You can click **View details** to see additional information, or click the link to **Download your reserved transactions** to view a .csv file of all your **Reserved** transactions.

trans-unit.source: **Upcoming payment** shows the number of upcoming payments, the amount of your next payment(s), and the payment creation date(s).
trans-unit.target: **Upcoming payment** shows the number of upcoming payments, the amount of your next payment(s), and the payment creation date(s).

trans-unit.source: If your eligible proceeds haven’t met the payment threshold yet, no upcoming payment will be shown here.
trans-unit.target: If your eligible proceeds haven’t met the payment threshold yet, no upcoming payment will be shown here.

trans-unit.source: You can click **View details** to see additional information, including the payment amount(s) and their respective revenue source.
trans-unit.target: You can click **View details** to see additional information, including the payment amount(s) and their respective revenue source.

trans-unit.source: **Most recent payment** shows the amount of the last payment attempted.
trans-unit.target: **Most recent payment** shows the amount of the last payment attempted.

trans-unit.source: If the payment was successful, the **View details** link will be blue, and you can click it to see the details for each payment.
trans-unit.target: If the payment was successful, the **View details** link will be blue, and you can click it to see the details for each payment.

trans-unit.source: Note that if we attempted to make multiple payments and only one of them was successful, only the amount of the successful payment will be shown here.
trans-unit.target: Note that if we attempted to make multiple payments and only one of them was successful, only the amount of the successful payment will be shown here.

trans-unit.source: If one or more payments failed, the **View details** link will be red and the number of failed payments will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: If one or more payments failed, the **View details** link will be red and the number of failed payments will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: You can click **View details** to see more details about the problem so that you can remedy the situation.
trans-unit.target: You can click **View details** to see more details about the problem so that you can remedy the situation.

trans-unit.source: Proceeds by app and adjustments
trans-unit.target: Proceeds by app and adjustments

trans-unit.source: This section breaks down the summary info to let you see specifics by app.
trans-unit.target: This section breaks down the summary info to let you see specifics by app.

trans-unit.source: If you earned money through Microsoft Advertising, the total amount of your advertising proceeds is shown here as a single line item.
trans-unit.target: If you earned money through Microsoft Advertising, the total amount of your advertising proceeds is shown here as a single line item.

trans-unit.source: By reviewing this section, you can determine which apps have earned money that’s currently in the **Reserved** or **Most recent payment** category.
trans-unit.target: By reviewing this section, you can determine which apps have earned money that’s currently in the **Reserved** or **Most recent payment** category.

trans-unit.source: You can also see the total amount you’ve received for each app.
trans-unit.target: You can also see the total amount you’ve received for each app.

trans-unit.source: If it was necessary to make any [adjustments](#adjust) to your account balance, you can view them here too.
trans-unit.target: If it was necessary to make any [adjustments](#adjust) to your account balance, you can view them here too.

trans-unit.source: (Note that adjustments for Microsoft Advertising proceeds are not currently shown here.)
trans-unit.target: (Note that adjustments for Microsoft Advertising proceeds are not currently shown here.)

trans-unit.source: Payment statements
trans-unit.target: Payment statements

trans-unit.source: In this section you can view statements for all successful monthly payments and see the total amount of money you've been paid.
trans-unit.target: In this section you can view statements for all successful monthly payments and see the total amount of money you've been paid.

trans-unit.source: The **Total paid to date** section shows the total amount you've been paid for all your sales.
trans-unit.target: The **Total paid to date** section shows the total amount you've been paid for all your sales.

trans-unit.source: Click **View details** to see the amounts that came from each revenue source.
trans-unit.target: Click **View details** to see the amounts that came from each revenue source.

trans-unit.source: Below the **Total paid to date** section, you will see your last three statements by default.
trans-unit.target: Below the **Total paid to date** section, you will see your last three statements by default.

trans-unit.source: To see the full statement (for successful payments), click **View**.
trans-unit.target: To see the full statement (for successful payments), click **View**.

trans-unit.source: You can access your historical payment statements through the drop-down box.
trans-unit.target: You can access your historical payment statements through the drop-down box.

trans-unit.source: At the top of each statement, you’ll see the total amount of your monthly payment.
trans-unit.target: At the top of each statement, you’ll see the total amount of your monthly payment.

trans-unit.source: Immediately below, in **Payments issued**, you’ll see a summary of how your payment amount was calculated.
trans-unit.target: Immediately below, in **Payments issued**, you’ll see a summary of how your payment amount was calculated.

trans-unit.source: Underneath, in the **Proceeds breakdown** section, you can view details on how much money was made per market and per revenue source (such as Windows Phone Store, Windows Store 8, Windows Store, etc.) by app.
trans-unit.target: Underneath, in the **Proceeds breakdown** section, you can view details on how much money was made per market and per revenue source (such as Windows Phone Store, Windows Store 8, Windows Store, etc.) by app.

trans-unit.source: You’ll also see details on any [adjustments](#adjust) that were made, including the date, amount, and reason for the adjustment.
trans-unit.target: You’ll also see details on any [adjustments](#adjust) that were made, including the date, amount, and reason for the adjustment.

trans-unit.source: Note that the sections mentioned above only show info on your proceeds (and adjustments) from app sales; if you earned money through advertising, you’ll see a separate Microsoft Advertising section with details about the payouts and currency conversions.
trans-unit.target: Note that the sections mentioned above only show info on your proceeds (and adjustments) from app sales; if you earned money through advertising, you’ll see a separate Microsoft Advertising section with details about the payouts and currency conversions.

trans-unit.source: Adjustments
trans-unit.target: Adjustments

trans-unit.source: Adjustment category
trans-unit.target: Adjustment category

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Compensatory adjustment
trans-unit.target: Compensatory adjustment

trans-unit.source: Any adjustment made to your payout balance that does not pertain to the other adjustment categories listed
trans-unit.target: Any adjustment made to your payout balance that does not pertain to the other adjustment categories listed

trans-unit.source: Historic balance
trans-unit.target: Historic balance

trans-unit.source: Payout balances from a historic payment system
trans-unit.target: Payout balances from a historic payment system

trans-unit.source: Passin tax
trans-unit.target: Passin tax

trans-unit.source: Tax adjustment related to sales in Korea
trans-unit.target: Tax adjustment related to sales in Korea

trans-unit.source: Downloading payment transactions
trans-unit.target: Downloading payment transactions

trans-unit.source: At the top of each statement, you’ll see a link to **Download transactions**.
trans-unit.target: At the top of each statement, you’ll see a link to **Download transactions**.

trans-unit.source: Click this link to get a .csv file with detailed info about each of the transactions included in your payment.
trans-unit.target: Click this link to get a .csv file with detailed info about each of the transactions included in your payment.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the fields that appear in the .csv file.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the fields that appear in the .csv file.

trans-unit.source: Note that the exact fields you see may vary as we continue to update our reporting.
trans-unit.target: Note that the exact fields you see may vary as we continue to update our reporting.

trans-unit.source: Field name
trans-unit.target: Field name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Revenue Source
trans-unit.target: Revenue Source

trans-unit.source: The source of your revenue, based on where the transaction occurred (such as Windows Phone Store, Windows Store 8, Windows Store, etc.)
trans-unit.target: The source of your revenue, based on where the transaction occurred (such as Windows Phone Store, Windows Store 8, Windows Store, etc.)

trans-unit.source: Transaction ID
trans-unit.target: Transaction ID

trans-unit.source: Unique transaction identifier
trans-unit.target: Unique transaction identifier

trans-unit.source: Transaction Date Time
trans-unit.target: Transaction Date Time

trans-unit.source: The date and time the transaction occurred (UTC)
trans-unit.target: The date and time the transaction occurred (UTC)

trans-unit.source: Parent Product ID
trans-unit.target: Parent Product ID

trans-unit.source: Unique parent product identifier.
trans-unit.target: Unique parent product identifier.

trans-unit.source: Please note: if there isn’t a parent product for the transaction, then Parent Product ID = Product ID.
trans-unit.target: Please note: if there isn’t a parent product for the transaction, then Parent Product ID = Product ID.

trans-unit.source: Product ID
trans-unit.target: Product ID

trans-unit.source: Unique product identifier
trans-unit.target: Unique product identifier

trans-unit.source: Parent Product Name
trans-unit.target: Parent Product Name

trans-unit.source: Name of the parent product.
trans-unit.target: Name of the parent product.

trans-unit.source: Please note: if there isn’t a parent product for the transaction, then Parent Product Name = Product Name.
trans-unit.target: Please note: if there isn’t a parent product for the transaction, then Parent Product Name = Product Name.

trans-unit.source: Product Name
trans-unit.target: Product Name

trans-unit.source: Name of the product
trans-unit.target: Name of the product

trans-unit.source: Product Type
trans-unit.target: Product Type

trans-unit.source: Type of product (such as App, In-App, Game, etc.)
trans-unit.target: Type of product (such as App, In-App, Game, etc.)

trans-unit.source: Transaction Type
trans-unit.target: Transaction Type

trans-unit.source: Type of transaction (such as purchase, refund, reversal, chargeback, etc.)
trans-unit.target: Type of transaction (such as purchase, refund, reversal, chargeback, etc.)

trans-unit.source: Payment Method
trans-unit.target: Payment Method

trans-unit.source: Customer payment instrument used for the transaction (such as credit card, mobile operator, etc,)
trans-unit.target: Customer payment instrument used for the transaction (such as credit card, mobile operator, etc,)

trans-unit.source: Country / Region
trans-unit.target: Country / Region

trans-unit.source: Country/region where the transaction occurred
trans-unit.target: Country/region where the transaction occurred

trans-unit.source: Local Provider / Seller
trans-unit.target: Local Provider / Seller

trans-unit.source: Local provider/seller of record
trans-unit.target: Local provider/seller of record

trans-unit.source: Transaction Currency
trans-unit.target: Transaction Currency

trans-unit.source: Currency of the transaction
trans-unit.target: Currency of the transaction

trans-unit.source: Transaction Amount
trans-unit.target: Transaction Amount

trans-unit.source: Amount of the transaction
trans-unit.target: Amount of the transaction

trans-unit.source: Tax Remitted
trans-unit.target: Tax Remitted

trans-unit.source: Amount of tax remitted (sales, use, or VAT/GST taxes)
trans-unit.target: Amount of tax remitted (sales, use, or VAT/GST taxes)

trans-unit.source: Net Receipts
trans-unit.target: Net Receipts

trans-unit.source: Transaction amount less tax remitted
trans-unit.target: Transaction amount less tax remitted

trans-unit.source: Store Fee
trans-unit.target: Store Fee

trans-unit.source: The percentage of Net Receipts retained by Microsoft as a fee for making the app or in-app product available in the Store
trans-unit.target: The percentage of Net Receipts retained by Microsoft as a fee for making the app or in-app product available in the Store

trans-unit.source: App Proceeds
trans-unit.target: App Proceeds

trans-unit.source: Net receipts minus the Store Fee
trans-unit.target: Net receipts minus the Store Fee

trans-unit.source: Taxes Withheld
trans-unit.target: Taxes Withheld

trans-unit.source: Amount of income tax withheld
trans-unit.target: Amount of income tax withheld

trans-unit.source: Payment
trans-unit.target: Payment

trans-unit.source: App Proceeds less any applicable income tax withholding (amount shown in Transaction Currency)
trans-unit.target: App Proceeds less any applicable income tax withholding (amount shown in Transaction Currency)

trans-unit.source: FX Rate
trans-unit.target: FX Rate

trans-unit.source: Foreign exchange rate used to convert Transaction Currency to Payment Currency
trans-unit.target: Foreign exchange rate used to convert Transaction Currency to Payment Currency

trans-unit.source: Payment Currency
trans-unit.target: Payment Currency

trans-unit.source: Currency your payment is made in
trans-unit.target: Currency your payment is made in

trans-unit.source: Converted Payment
trans-unit.target: Converted Payment

trans-unit.source: Payment amount converted to Payment Currency using the FX Rate
trans-unit.target: Payment amount converted to Payment Currency using the FX Rate

trans-unit.source: Tax Remit Model
trans-unit.target: Tax Remit Model

trans-unit.source: Party responsible for remitting taxes (sales, use, or VAT/GST taxes)
trans-unit.target: Party responsible for remitting taxes (sales, use, or VAT/GST taxes)

trans-unit.source: Charges
trans-unit.target: Charges

trans-unit.source: Shows a breakdown of all the charge details aggregated in the Transaction Amount column.
trans-unit.target: Shows a breakdown of all the charge details aggregated in the Transaction Amount column.

trans-unit.source: (Only included for Azure Marketplace.)
trans-unit.target: (Only included for Azure Marketplace.)
